level.heading: ORDERING FROM THE SUPPLY SCHEDULES (ยง 27-2104)

level.text: When ordering from a single-award schedule, the contracting officer shall place orders directly with the schedule contractor at the price shown in the schedule.
Except as provided in ยง2104.3, when ordering from a multiple-award schedule, the contracting officer shall place orders with the schedule contractor offering the lowest delivered price available.

The contracting officer shall justify any order over five hundred dollars ($500) per line item placed at other than the lowest price. Justification for ordering a higher priced item may be based on any of the following considerations:
Delivery time in terms of actual need that cannot be met by a contractor offering a lower price;
Specific or unusual requirements, such as differences in performance characteristics;
Compatibility with existing equipment or systems; or
Trade-in considerations that favor a higher priced item and produce the lowest net cost.
